summary: Did you bother to kill the Reaper in Dawnguard and got bummed out over the loot? Mod adds 10 enchanted and quite powerful rings from his victims that you can pick amongst.
descriptionHtml:
Did you bother to kill the Reaper in Dawnguard and got bummed out over the loot? Mod adds 10 enchanted and quite powerful rings from his victims that you can pick amongst. The enchanted rings is worth only the same as normal counterparts due to the blessing they grant is only given to you.

Already killed the Reaper? Thats what console command is for ^^

I put this mod in cheat category due the strength of the rings, but shouldnt be that badly balanced if you only use one. 
Balance of the rings compared to each other is up for debate, but you got the permission to change the stats as you see fit, I can even upload the alternative version.

Stats:
Unfortunate Adventurer\'s Blessing: 50 stamina, 50 carry weigth and 60 health.
Unfortunate Barbarian\'s Blessing: 30% more dmg on 2hand, 80 health, 45 stamina and 25% stamina regen.
Unfortunate Courier\'s Blessing: 105 stamina, 30 carry weigth and 50% stamina regen.
Unfortunate Physician\'s Blessing: 50 health, 25% health regen, 40% restoration cost reduction.
Unfortunate Ranger\'s Blessing: 30% archery dmg and 30 sneak bonus.
Unfortunate Slayer\'s Blessing: 30% more dmg on 2hand, 35%magic resist and 100% poison and disease resist.
Unfortunate Thief\'s Blessing: 30 lockpick bonus, 30 sneak bonus and 30 pickpocket bonus.
Unfortunate Warlock\'s Blessing: 100 magicka, 40% destruction cost reduction.
Unfortunate Warrior\'s Blessing: 30% 1hand dmg, 80 health, 20 armor and 40 stamina.
Unfortunate Witch\'s Blessing: 25% magic reist, 15 bonus to Alteration&Illusion and 30 to Conjuration.

4th minor issue mod from me, weee. Check out rest on profile. Thanks.
author: Dragon89  Shocky
